docs.lead_paragraph: California Governor Jerry Brown signed a $156.3 billion budget plan on Friday that includes funding for a controversial high-speed rail project and a so-called rainy day fund in line with the governor's vision of fiscal restraint, his office said.

headline.main: California Governor Signs $156.3 Billion Budget With Rainy Day Fund
headline.print_headline: California Governor Signs $156.3 Billion Budget With Rainy Day Fund

docs.snippet: California Governor Jerry Brown signed a $156.3 billion budget plan on Friday that includes funding for a controversial high-speed rail project and a so-called rainy day fund in line with the governor's vision of fiscal restraint, his office said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Buyout firms TPG Capital and Carlyle Group are targeting a $2.4 billion initial public offering of shares in Australia's Healthscope Ltd as their most-favored option for the country's second-biggest private hospitals operator, a source with direct knowledge of plans told Reuters.

headline.main: TPG, Carlyle Eye $2.4 Billion IPO for Australia's Healthscope: Source
headline.print_headline: TPG, Carlyle Eye $2.4 Billion IPO for Australia's Healthscope: Source

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new reports suggest that Americans are finding bargains and a wide choice of insurance plans thanks to the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Good Progress on Affordable Health Care
headline.print_headline: Good Progress on Affordable Health Care

docs.abstract: Editorial contends reports from Health and Human Services Dept and Kaiser Family Foundation show that Affordable Care Act has benefited many Americans, offering them ability to find bargains and wide choice of insurance plans; maintains that every success made possible by the law will make it much harder for its political enemies to repeal or disable it.
docs.snippet: Two new reports suggest that Americans are finding bargains and a wide choice of insurance plans thanks to the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The health care scandal at Veterans Affairs is real, but it’s being hyped out of proportion in an attempt to block reform of the larger national system.

headline.seo: The Hype Behind the Health Care Scandal

docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column warns that scandal at Veterans Affairs Dept should not distract nation from the inefficiency and injustice of the American health care system as a whole; contends Republicans have seized upon scandal at Veterans Affairs because system run by the department is an island of socialized medicine in a privatized sea; warns that Republicans hope to use veterans' care scandal to derail health reform.
docs.snippet: The health care scandal at Veterans Affairs is real, but it’s being hyped out of proportion in an attempt to block reform of the larger national system.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A survey finds that six in 10 people joining the new health plans had no insurance before, many are worried about affording premiums, and opinions about benefits are a mixed bag.

headline.main: Health Exchange Enrollees Had Mostly Been Uninsured
headline.print_headline: Health Exchange Enrollees Had Mostly Been Uninsured

docs.abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation survey finds that 4 in 10 people enrolling in health plans through new insurance exchanges already had insurance, but 6 in 10 were previously uninsured; notes that many are worried about being able to afford premiums, and that opinions about benefits are a mixed bag.
docs.snippet: A survey finds that six in 10 people joining the new health plans had no insurance before, many are worried about affording premiums, and opinions about benefits are a mixed bag.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors and financial regulators are seeking records from the panel as part of an inquiry into a surge in stock prices of health insurers.

headline.main: Congressional Panel Subpoenaed in Insider Trading Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Congressional Panel Subpoenaed in Insider Trading Inquiry

docs.abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission and Justice Department subpoena Rep David Camp, Republican of Michigan and chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, as part of insider trading investigation into Height Securities; research company correctly predicted change in government health care policy in 2013, prompting a surge in stock prices of health insurance companies.
docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors and financial regulators are seeking records from the panel as part of an inquiry into a surge in stock prices of health insurers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Individuals who purchased health insurance set up under U.S. President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law rate their personal health as worse than people who bought individual plans elsewhere, a Kaiser Family Foundation survey found.

headline.main: Obamacare Insurance Holders Rate Themselves Sicker: Survey
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Insurance Holders Rate Themselves Sicker: Survey

docs.snippet: Individuals who purchased health insurance set up under U.S. President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law rate their personal health as worse than people who bought individual plans elsewhere, a Kaiser Family Foundation survey found.
